intro: Pochota fuscolepidota, commonly known as the Mexican coffee tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Fabaceae family. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pod-like fruits that contain edible seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine. The tree can reach heights of up to 10 meters and thrives in well-drained soils with adequate sunlight.
